title: Medical Definition of Complementary medicine
author: Medical Editor Jay W Marks; MD
description: Read medical definition of Complementary medicine
cleaned_text: Complementary medicine: A group of diagnostic and [therapeutic](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=18811) disciplines that are used together with [conventional medicine](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=33527). An example of a complementary [therapy](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=10897) is using acupuncture [in](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=3950) addition to usual care to help lessen a [patient](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=39154)'s discomfort following [surgery](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=5603). [Complementary medicine](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=31077) is different from [alternative medicine](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=2211). Whereas complementary medicine is used together with conventional medicine, alternative medicine is used in place of conventional medicine. An example of an alternative therapy is using a special diet to treat cancer instead of undergoing surgery, radiation, or chemotherapy that has been recommended by a [physician](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=4887). According to the National Center for Complementary and Alternative Medicine of the [National Institutes of Health](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=9786) ( [NIH](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=4565)), complementary and alternative homeopathy, [hypnosis](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=10809), - massage therapy, [meditation](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=10807), [naturopathy](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=11735), - nutritional therapy, - osteopathic manipulative therapy (OMT), [Qi gong](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=31105)(internal and external Qigong), - reflexology, [Reiki](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=31106), - spiritual healing, - Tai Chi, [traditional Chinese Medicine](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=33520)( [TCM](https://www.rxlist.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=33521)), and - yoga.
